block.p: A Correction: Petsmart.com A front-page article on Sunday about the increasing prices at many Web retailers misstated the status of Petsmart.com. The company is in business and has not been sold. In fact, it is preparing for its initial public offering of stock.

Europe's Antitrust Chief May Block WorldCom Deal The top antitrust officer of the European Commission, Mario Monti, said he would advise the commission to block WorldCom from buying Sprint unless the companies significantly altered the terms of the deal before the commission's July 12 deadline.
In another telecommunications development, Qwest Communications International's $57 billion takeover of U S West received final federal regulatory approval. [Page C2.]

A Correction: Petsmart.com A front-page article on Sunday about the increasing prices at many Web retailers misstated the status of Petsmart.com. The company is in business and has not been sold. In fact, it is preparing for its initial public offering of stock.

Europe's Antitrust Chief May Block WorldCom Deal The top antitrust officer of the European Commission, Mario Monti, said he would advise the commission to block WorldCom from buying Sprint unless the companies significantly altered the terms of the deal before the commission's July 12 deadline.
In another telecommunications development, Qwest Communications International's $57 billion takeover of U S West received final federal regulatory approval. [Page C2.]

Dow Climbs on Philip Morris Deal Philip Morris drove the Dow Jones industrial average higher as investors applauded its plan to acquire the snack-food business of Nabisco Holdings. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 138.24 points, or 1.3 percent, to 10,542.99. The Standard & Poor's 500-stock index was up 13.83 points, or nearly 1 percent, to 1,455.31, and the Nasdaq composite index was up 66.78 points, or 1.7 percent, to 3,912.12. [C14.]

Warnaco Countersues Calvin Klein Warnaco Group, which makes underwear and jeanswear under the Calvin Klein label, answered a lawsuit by Calvin Klein by filing a countersuit seeking nearly $1 billion in damages from Calvin Klein Inc. and the designer. The complaints against the company include defamation, breach of good faith and interference with its business practices. [C27.]

For Vivendi, a Question of Synergies Since the announcement of Vivendi's $41 billion deal to acquire Seagram last week, analysts have been squinting to see the synergies between Vivendi -- which owns environmental, waste and communications businesses -- and Seagram, which owns a major record company, film studio, theme park business and liquor operation. Still, Vivendi's chairman, Jean-Marie Messier, plans to sell the concept of a wireless Internet world where Vivendi's acquisition would reap a windfall. [C6.]

Xerox Turns to Blue Dogs for Ads Xerox, a name synonymous with pricey corporate copiers, is about to begin an advertising campaign for low-priced ink-jet printers for the home. The centerpiece of the campaign will be the cult-like Blue Dogs of the painter George Rodrigue. Advertising. [C8.]

Existing-Home Sales Up 4.3% in May Sales of existing homes increased by a strong 4.3 percent in May and prices crept higher, as pent-up demand caused by a slim choice of homes for sale kept activity buoyant despite higher mortgage rates. The National Association of Realtors said that sales in May rose to an annual pace of 5.09 million units from 4.88 million in April. This surpassed expectations of Wall Street economists, who had predicted no change. [C14.]

Lucent to Announce New Brand Lucent Technologies will announce a new brand today for its unit that sells communications products to business customers. The unit is in the process of being spun out of Lucent as an independent company. Lucent plans no initial public offering of stock in the new company, and intends to distribute all the shares directly to its own shareholders. [C27.]

Managed Care Companies Are Sued Six managed care companies were accused of misleading health plan members in lawsuits filed in a federal district court in Miami, where a judge recently promised a speedy decision in a similar suit against Humana. [C2.]

Webvan Is Buying HomeGrocer.com The much-anticipated consolidation of the online grocery market got under way with the announcement that the Webvan Group would acquire HomeGrocer.com in a stock swap valued at approximately $1.2 billion. [C10.]
